Package io.github.ai4ci.util

Class Inversion<Y,X>

java.lang.Object
io.github.ai4ci.util.Inversion<Y,X>
Type Parameters:
Y - a key-like object
X - a value-like object
All Implemented Interfaces:
Function<Y,Set<X>>
public class Inversion<Y,X> extends Object implements Function<Y,Set<X>>
Given a stream of objects of type X, and a mapping that extracts objects of type Y, this class creates an index of type Y and acts as a function for retrieving the set of X which map to Y. This is basically the same as a foreign key lookup.

  • Method Details

    • cache

      public static <Y, X> Inversion<Y,X> cache(Function<X,Y> fn, Stream<X> data)
      cache the inversion of a function over a stream of data.
      Type Parameters:
      Y - the type of the key-like objects to retrieve
      X - the type of the value-like objects to retrieve
      Parameters:
      fn - the function to invert; should be a mapping from X to Y
      data - the stream of X objects to process and cache
      Returns:
      an Inversion object that can be used to retrieve sets of X for given Y values

    • apply

      public Set<X> apply(Y t)
      Apply the inversion function to retrieve the set of X that map to Y.
      Specified by:
      apply in interface Function<Y,X>
      Parameters:
      t - the key-like object for which to retrieve the corresponding set of value-like objects
      Returns:
      a set of X objects that map to the given Y object; returns an empty set if no mappings exist

    • apply

      public <Y1, X1> Set<X1> apply(Y1 t, Class<X1> as)
      Apply the inversion function with type checking to retrieve the set of X that map to Y.
      Type Parameters:
      Y1 - the type of the key-like object for which to retrieve the corresponding set of value-like objects; should be compatible with Y
      X1 - the expected type of the value-like objects in the output
      Parameters:
      t - the key-like object for which to retrieve the corresponding set of value-like objects
      as - the class object representing the expected output type; used for type checking
      Returns:
      a set of X objects that map to the given Y object; returns an empty set if no mappings exist
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input type of t does not match the expected input type or if the output type does not match the expected output type

    • applyUnsafe

      public <Y1> Set<X> applyUnsafe(Y1 t)
      Apply the inversion function without type checking to retrieve the set of X that map to Y.
      Type Parameters:
      Y1 - the type of the key-like object for which to retrieve the corresponding set of value-like objects; should be compatible with Y
      Parameters:
      t - the key-like object for which to retrieve the corresponding set of value-like objects
      Returns:
      a set of X objects that map to the given Y object; returns an empty set if no mappings exist
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input type of t does not match the expected input type

    • outputType

      public Class<X> outputType()
      Get the input type of the inversion function.
      Returns:
      the Class object representing the input type Y
